intro: Lappula matsudairae, commonly known as the Japanese lappula, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its structure includes erect stems and basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Lappula matsudairae is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
